channel.title: 7 on Santosh Bhattarai
channel.description: Recent content in 7 on Santosh Bhattarai

item.title: Satellite clock time offset prediction in Global Navigation Satellite Systems
item.description: In an operational sense, satellite clock time offset prediction (SCTOP) is a fundamental requirement in global navigation satellite systems (GNSS) technology. SCTOP uncertainty is a significant component of the uncertainty budget of the basic GNSS pseudorange measurements used in standard (i.e not high-precision), single-receiver applications. In real-time, this prediction uncertainty contributes directly to GNSS-based positioning, navigation and timing (PNT) uncertainty. In short, GNSS performance in intrinsically linked to satellite clock predictability.
